intro: Cracca glabella, commonly known as the smooth cracca, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands. The leaves are smooth and glossy, with a distinctive shape that helps in its identification.
